00054 
00062 void N_Timer_Start32(int32_t timeoutMs, N_Timer_t* pTimer);
00063 
00065 void N_Timer_Start16(uint16_t timeoutMs, N_Timer_t* pTimer);
00066 
00067 /* Reload a timer.
00068     \param intervalMs The timer interval in milliseconds.
00069     \param pTimer The timer to reload.
00070 
00071     This function can be used to create a reloading/repeating timer. It
00072     should only be called while handling the expiration of pTimer.
00073 
00074     Note that it does not start a timer that will keep on running.
00075     Instead this function must be called each time the timer expires.
00076 
00077     The next timeout will be interval milliseconds after the
00078     previous expiration time, so event handling latencies are ignored.
00079     If the next timeout has already expired, the event will fire immediately.
00080 */
00081 void N_Timer_Reload32(int32_t intervalMs, N_Timer_t* pTimer);
00082 
00083 /* Cheaper to use version of \ ref N_Timer_Reload32 for small intervals. */
00084 void N_Timer_Reload16(uint16_t intervalMs, N_Timer_t* pTimer);
00085 
00091 void N_Timer_Stop(N_Timer_t* pTimer);
00092 
00100 bool N_Timer_IsRunning(N_Timer_t* pTimer);
00101 
00106 int32_t N_Timer_GetRemaining(N_Timer_t* pTimer);
00107 
00111 uint32_t N_Timer_GetSystemTime(void);
00112 
00121 bool N_Timer_Expire(N_Task_Id_t task, N_Task_Event_t evt);
00122
